Brian Chesky.short_description: Co-founder and CEO of Airbnb, and the 290th richest person in the world according to Forbes with a net worth of $9.2 billion.

education.degree: Bachelor of Fine Arts degree in industrial design

current_role.title: CEO
current_role.description: As CEO, Chesky has solicited ideas for improving Airbnb directly from customers and has implemented ideas based on his personal experiences as both a guest and a host on the platform.
achievements: Airbnb became a public company via an initial public offering in December 2020.

roles.title: Co-founder and CEO
roles.description: Chesky co-founded Airbnb and has been serving as its CEO since its inception. He has been instrumental in the company's growth and success.

achievements: Airbnb's successful transition to a public company

roles.title: Co-founder

Daniel Kan.short_description: Dutch mathematician who made significant contributions to category theory and homotopy theory

current_role.title: Emeritus Professor
current_role.description: Retired professor who taught at MIT from 1959 to 1993

roles.title: Professor
roles.description: Taught mathematics, specifically category theory and homotopy theory
responsibilities: Teaching
Research in category theory and homotopy theory
achievements: Contributed to the beginnings of modern homotopy theory
Authored or coauthored several dozen research papers and monographs
His work on adjoint functors and the Kan extension is highly regarded
Made significant contributions to the theory of simplicial sets and simplicial methods in topology

current_role.title: Co-founder and President
current_role.description: Oversees the strategic direction and operations of Stripe, a technology company that builds economic infrastructure for the internet.
achievements: Led Stripe to become a leading payment processing platform valued at $9.2 billion in 2016.
Contributed $1 million to California YIMBY, a pro-housing development lobbying organization.

roles.title: Co-founder and President
roles.description: Co-founded Stripe with his brother Patrick, focusing on building payment solutions for businesses.
responsibilities: Strategic planning and execution of company vision.
Management of company operations and team leadership.
achievements: Achieved a valuation of $9.2 billion in 2016.
Ranked 15th in Forbes' list of America's Richest Entrepreneurs Under 40 in 2016.

roles.title: Co-founder
roles.description: Co-founded Auctomatic, a software company that developed tools for eBay.
responsibilities: Developed software solutions for e-commerce.
Collaborated with investors and stakeholders.
achievements: Successfully merged with another company and sold for $5 million.

roles.title: Co-founder
roles.description: Founded Shuppa with his brother Patrick, focusing on e-commerce solutions.
responsibilities: Initial business development and product ideation.
Engaged with early-stage investors.
achievements: Merged with Auctomatic, leading to a successful acquisition.

Patrick Collison.short_description: Patrick Collison is the co-founder and CEO of Stripe, a leading online payment processing platform.

current_role.title: CEO
current_role.description: Oversees the strategic direction and operations of Stripe, a technology company that builds economic infrastructure for the internet.
achievements: Led Stripe to become a $35 billion valued company as of September 2019.
Contributed $1 million to California YIMBY, a pro-housing development lobbying organization in 2018.
Co-founded Fast Grants in 2020 to accelerate COVID-19-related science.

roles.title: Co-founder
roles.description: Co-founded Auctomatic, a software company that provided tools for online sellers.
responsibilities: Developed software solutions for e-commerce.
Managed engineering and product development.
achievements: Sold Auctomatic to Live Current Media in March 2008, becoming a millionaire at age 19.
Served as Director of Engineering at Live Current Media's Vancouver base.

roles.title: Co-founder
roles.description: Co-founded Stripe to simplify online payment processing for businesses.
responsibilities: Led product development and company strategy.
Oversaw fundraising efforts and investor relations.
achievements: Raised $2 million in initial funding from notable investors in 2011.
Achieved a valuation of $9.2 billion in 2016, making the Collison brothers the youngest self-made billionaires.

William MacAskill.short_description: William MacAskill is a Scottish philosopher and author, co-founder of the effective altruism movement.

current_role.title: Research Fellow
current_role.company: Global Priorities Institute, University of Oxford
current_role.description: Conducting research on effective altruism and decision-making under normative uncertainty.
achievements: Contributed to the development of effective altruism as a movement
Published influential research articles in ethics and philosophy

roles.title: Associate Professor
roles.description: Taught and conducted research in philosophy, focusing on effective altruism and normative uncertainty.
responsibilities: Developed and delivered undergraduate and graduate courses
Supervised student research projects
achievements: Elected to an associate professorship
Published articles in leading philosophy journals

roles.title: Junior Research Fellow
roles.description: Engaged in independent research and contributed to the academic community.
responsibilities: Conducted research on moral philosophy
Participated in academic seminars and discussions
achievements: Published research findings
Built a network within the academic community

roles.title: Co-founder
roles.description: Encouraged individuals to pledge a portion of their income to effective charities.
responsibilities: Developed organizational strategies
Engaged with donors and charities
achievements: Helped establish a community of effective altruists
Influenced charitable giving practices

roles.title: Co-founder
roles.description: Created an umbrella organization to promote effective altruism initiatives.
responsibilities: Oversaw organizational development
Collaborated with various stakeholders
achievements: Expanded the reach of effective altruism
Launched multiple initiatives to promote effective giving

Mattias Lepp.short_description: Founder of Click and Grow, an innovative indoor gardening company specializing in smart plant growing solutions.

current_role.title: Founder and CEO
current_role.description: Oversees the development and marketing of consumer electronic products for indoor gardening, focusing on innovative solutions for growing edible plants.
achievements: Successfully launched multiple product lines including Smart Flowerpot, Smart Herb Garden, and Smart Garden series.
Expanded the company to over 450,000 customers and established offices in San Francisco, Tartu, and Tallinn.
Secured investment from INGKA Holding in 2018.

roles.title: Founder
roles.description: Founded Click and Grow, leading the company in developing innovative indoor gardening solutions.
responsibilities: Conceptualized and developed the Smart Flowerpot and other indoor gardening products.
Managed company operations and strategic direction.
Led fundraising efforts including successful Kickstarter campaigns.
achievements: Won the Ajujaht business idea competition in 2010.
Achieved significant sales growth during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Introduced products that have sold over 90,000 units in the first year.

Pia Mancini.short_description: Pia Mancini is an activist and technical project leader known for co-founding Democracy Earth and Open Collective.

current_role.title: Co-founder
current_role.description: Co-founded a platform that allows open-source project groups to collect and spend money semi-transparently.
achievements: Developed a platform that supports financial transparency for open-source projects.
Facilitated donations for open source code contributors.

roles.title: Co-founder
roles.description: Co-founded a non-profit organization that provides an online platform for political groups.
responsibilities: Developing tools for political engagement.
Supporting citizen participation in governance.
achievements: Established a platform that enhances political group organization.
Promoted the use of technology in democratic processes.

roles.title: Founder
roles.description: Founded a non-profit to support citizen participation in government through technology.
responsibilities: Creating tools for public engagement.
Launching initiatives to improve democratic processes.
achievements: Released DemocracyOS, an online app for citizen engagement with legislation.

roles.title: Co-founder
roles.description: Co-founded a political party that acts according to people's wishes expressed online.
responsibilities: Advocating for online citizen engagement in politics.
Building a political platform based on digital participation.
achievements: Established a political party focused on direct democracy.

roles.title: Political Worker
roles.description: Worked for an Argentine political party but left due to dissatisfaction with public responsiveness.
responsibilities: Engaging with party activities.
Attempting to influence political processes.
achievements: Identified gaps in political responsiveness leading to the creation of Net Democracy.

Long Vo.short_description: Long Vo is an entrepreneur and creative director known for co-founding Gaia Online and his contributions to the gaming and comic book industries.

current_role.title: CoFounder and COO
current_role.description: Leading provider for Web Push and Mobile Push Notifications for Websites and Apps.
achievements: Established OneSignal as a leader in push notification services
Continues to contribute to the Fighting Games community through design work

roles.title: Founder and Creative Director
roles.description: Oversees the development of mobile games and original IP.
responsibilities: Leading game design and development
Managing creative direction for mobile game projects
achievements: Developed successful mobile games like GO NINJA and SHAQDOWN
Released DiverDogs, featured as Best New Games

roles.title: Co-Founder
roles.description: Helped establish one of the first social gaming platforms.
responsibilities: Developing the platform and community
Managing partnerships with venture firms
achievements: Grew the platform to over 26 million registered users
Secured backing from major venture firms

roles.title: Lead Sprite Designer and Illustrator
roles.description: Contributed artwork and design for various Capcom titles.
responsibilities: Creating sprite designs for high-profile games
Providing illustrations for collector's editions
achievements: Lead sprite designer for Super Street Fighter II Turbo HD Remix
Contributed to Street Fighter V: Arcade Edition as Lead Ending Illustrator

roles.title: Manager
roles.description: Managed a comic studio producing illustrations and comic books.
responsibilities: Overseeing production of comic works
Collaborating with various publishers
achievements: Produced works for major comic publishers like Marvel and DC
Established a reputation in the comic book industry

Iba Masood.short_description: Iba Masood is the founder of Gradberry.com, a platform aimed at connecting students with job opportunities.

current_role.title: Founder
current_role.description: Leading the development and growth of Gradberry.com, focusing on bridging the gap between students and employers.
achievements: Established a platform that connects students with job opportunities.
Developed partnerships with various educational institutions and companies.

roles.title: Founder
roles.description: Responsible for the overall vision and strategy of Gradberry.com.
responsibilities: Overseeing platform development and user engagement.
Building relationships with educational institutions and employers.
achievements: Successfully launched the platform.
Increased user base significantly since inception.
